sentences.en: The constitution proclaims that public property shall be inviolate.
sentences.cn: 宪法宣告公共财产不可侵犯.

sentences.en: The great inviolate place bad the ancient permanence which the sea cannot claim.
sentences.cn: 这块没经过骚扰(真的)伟大土地有着自古以来永远不变的性质,这种性质建大海都不能跟它相比.

sentences.en: The great inviolate place had an ancient permanence which the sea cannot claim ( Thomas hardy )
sentences.cn: 这个伟大的未遭破坏的地方具有一种大海也无法索求的古老的永恒 ( 托马斯·哈迪 )

sentences.en: The great inviolate place had an ancient permanence which the sea cannot claim ( Thomas Hardy )
sentences.cn: 这个伟大的未遭破坏的地方具有一种大海也无法索求的古老的永恒 ( 托马斯哈迪 )
我们这个岛令人莫测高深, 是不可侵犯的.

sentences.en: They considered themselves inviolate from attack.
sentences.cn: 他们认为自己是不可侵犯的.

sentences.en: To know that it was there, inviolate , was almost the same as being in it.
sentences.cn: 知道它毫发无损, 平平安安, 那感觉就和呆在屋里差不多.

sentences.en: We believed our love was inviolate.
sentences.cn: 我们相信我们的爱情坚如磐石。

words.tran_cn: 不可侵犯的；神圣的；不可亵渎的
无污点的；未亵渎的，未受侵犯的

trans.tran_cn: 不受侵犯的，未受损害的
trans.tran_en: something that is inviolate cannot be attacked, changed, or destroyed
